availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York } SS.

Adrian VanSinderen being duly sworn deposes and says that he will well and faithfully to the best of his ability execute and discharge the proper duties and offices of Commissioner of the State of Kentucky in the State of New York and that the annexed is an impression of his official seal as such Commissioner.
Subscribed and sworn to this 6th day of July, 1863.

Before me
Ed Randolph Robinson
Notary Public N. Y.

figure.ab:
ED. RANDOLPH ROBINSON
NOTARY
PUBLIC
NEW YORK

body.p:
New York
Oath of A. VanSinderen
Comr of Deeds
Filed July 9. 1863
